alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Pleasants; Ritchie; Roane; Wirt; Wood (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 5:24AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Meigs, southeastern Athens, southern Pleasants, Calhoun, Ritchie, Gilmer, Braxton, Wirt, Roane, northern Clay, eastern Jackson and Wood Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 523 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near North Bend State Park to near Coolville. Movement was southeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Belpre, Spencer, Harrisville, Glenville, Sutton, Elizabeth, Grantsville, Coolville, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Pennsboro, Gassaway, Sandyville, Mineralwells, Arnoldsburg, Cedar Creek State Park, Washington, North Bend State Park and Lubeck. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 22 and 77. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 127 and 129, and between mile markers 145 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Pleasants; Ritchie; Roane; Wirt; Wood
